verses.verse: I <S%H559>said<s%> in my <S%H3820>heart,<s%> "Come <S%H3212>now,<s%> I will <S%H5254>test<s%> you with <S%H8057>mirth:<s%> therefore <S%H7200>enjoy<s%> <S%H2896>pleasure;<s%>" and <S%H1892>behold,<s%> this also was vanity.
I <S%H559>said<s%> of <S%H7814>laughter,<s%> "It is <S%H1984>foolishness;<s%>" and of <S%H8057>mirth,<s%> <S%H2090>"What<s%> does it <S%H6213>accomplish?<s%>"

I <S%H8446>searched<s%> in my <S%H3820>heart<s%> how to <S%H4900>cheer<s%> <S%H1320>my<s%> flesh with <S%H3196>wine,<s%> my <S%H3820>heart<s%> yet <S%H5090>guiding<s%> me with <S%H2451>wisdom,<s%> and how to lay <S%H270>hold<s%> of <S%H5531>folly,<s%> until I might <S%H7200>see<s%> what it was <S%H2896>good<s%> for the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%> that they should <S%H6213>do<s%> under <S%H8064>heaven<s%> <S%H4557>all<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of their <S%H2416>lives.<s%>
I made myself <S%H1431>great<s%> <S%H4639>works.<s%> I <S%H1129>built<s%> myself <S%H1004>houses.<s%> I <S%H5193>planted<s%> myself <S%H3754>vineyards.<s%>
I <S%H6213>made<s%> myself <S%H1593>gardens<s%> and <S%H6508>parks,<s%> and I <S%H5193>planted<s%> <S%H6086>trees<s%> in them of all kinds of <S%H6529>fruit.<s%>
I <S%H6213>made<s%> myself <S%H1295>pools<s%> of <S%H4325>water,<s%> to <S%H8248>water<s%> from it the <S%H3293>forest<s%> where <S%H3293>trees<s%> were <S%H6779>reared.<s%>

I <S%H7069>bought<s%> male <S%H5650>servants<s%> and female <S%H8198>servants,<s%> and had servants <S%H1121>born<s%> in my <S%H1004>house.<s%> I also had <S%H7235>great<s%> <S%H4735>possessions<s%> of <S%H6629>herds<s%> and <S%H1241>flocks,<s%> above all who were <S%H6440>before<s%> me in <S%H3389>Jerusalem;<s%>

I also <S%H3664>gathered<s%> <S%H3701>silver<s%> and <S%H2091>gold<s%> for <S%H5459>myself,<s%> and the treasure of <S%H4428>kings<s%> and of the <S%H4082>provinces.<s%> I <S%H6213>got<s%> myself <S%H7891>male<s%> and female <S%H7891>singers,<s%> and the <S%H8588>delights<s%> of the <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H120>men<s%>—musical <S%H7705>instruments,<s%> and that of all sorts.
So I was <S%H1431>great,<s%> and <S%H3254>increased<s%> more than all who were <S%H6440>before<s%> me in <S%H3389>Jerusalem.<s%> My <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> also remained with <S%H5975>me.<s%>

Whatever my <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7592>desired,<s%> I <S%H680>didn't<s%> keep from <S%H4513>them.<s%> I didn't withhold my <S%H3820>heart<s%> from any <S%H8057>joy,<s%> for my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H8056>rejoiced<s%> because of all my <S%H5999>labor,<s%> and this was my <S%H2506>portion<s%> from all my <S%H5999>labor.<s%>

Then I <S%H6437>looked<s%> at all the <S%H4639>works<s%> that my <S%H3027>hands<s%> had <S%H6213>worked,<s%> and at the <S%H5999>labor<s%> that I had <S%H5999>labored<s%> to <S%H6213>do;<s%> and <S%H1892>behold,<s%> all was vanity and a <S%H7469>chasing<s%> after <S%H7307>wind,<s%> and there was no <S%H3504>profit<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun.<s%>

I <S%H6437>turned<s%> myself to <S%H7200>consider<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom,<s%> <S%H1947>madness,<s%> and <S%H5531>folly:<s%> for what can <S%H120>the<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%>'s <S%H935><s%> <S%H310>successor<s%> <S%H6213>do?<s%> Just that which has been done long <S%H3528>ago.<s%>
Then I <S%H7200>saw<s%> <S%H3426>that<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom<s%> <S%H3504>excels<s%> <S%H5531>folly,<s%> as far as <S%H216>light<s%> <S%H3504>excels<s%> <S%H2822>darkness.<s%>

The wise <S%H2450>man<s%>'s <S%H5869>eyes<s%> are in his <S%H7218>head,<s%> and the <S%H3684>fool<s%> <S%H1980>walks<s%> in <S%H2822>darkness<s%>—and yet I <S%H3045>perceived<s%> that <S%H259>one<s%> <S%H4745>event<s%> happens to them <S%H7136>all.<s%>

<S%H227>Then<s%> I <S%H559>said<s%> in my <S%H3820>heart,<s%> "As it <S%H4745>happens<s%> to the <S%H3684>fool,<s%> so will it <S%H7136>happen<s%> even to <S%H1571>me;<s%> and why was I then <S%H3148>more<s%> <S%H2449>wise?<s%>" Then I <S%H1696>said<s%> in my <S%H3820>heart<s%> that this also is <S%H1892>vanity.<s%>

For of the <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H5973>man,<s%> even as of the <S%H3684>fool,<s%> there is no <S%H2146>memory<s%> for <S%H5769>ever,<s%> <S%H3528>since<s%> in the <S%H3117>days<s%> to <S%H935>come<s%> all will have been long <S%H7911>forgotten.<s%> <S%H2450>Indeed,<s%> the wise man must <S%H4191>die<s%> just like the <S%H3684>fool!<s%>

So I <S%H8130>hated<s%> <S%H2416>life,<s%> because the <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>worked<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun<s%> was <S%H7451>grievous<s%> to <S%H1892>me;<s%> for all is vanity and a <S%H7469>chasing<s%> after <S%H7307>wind.<s%>
I <S%H8130>hated<s%> all my <S%H5999>labor<s%> in which I <S%H5999>labored<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun,<s%> because I must <S%H3240>leave<s%> it to the <S%H120>man<s%> who comes after <S%H310>me.<s%>

Who <S%H3045>knows<s%> whether he will be a <S%H2450>wise<s%> man or a <S%H5530>fool?<s%> Yet he will have <S%H7980>rule<s%> over all of my <S%H5999>labor<s%> in which I have <S%H5999>labored,<s%> and in which I have shown myself <S%H2449>wise<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun.<s%> This also is <S%H1892>vanity.<s%>

Therefore I <S%H5437>began<s%> to <S%H2976>cause<s%> my <S%H3820>heart<s%> to <S%H2976>despair<s%> concerning all the <S%H5999>labor<s%> in which I had <S%H5999>labored<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun.<s%>

For there <S%H3426>is<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> whose <S%H5999>labor<s%> is with <S%H2451>wisdom,<s%> with <S%H1847>knowledge,<s%> and with <S%H5998>skillfulness;<s%> yet he shall <S%H5414>leave<s%> it for his <S%H2506>portion<s%> to a <S%H120>man<s%> who has not <S%H5998>labored<s%> for <S%H1892>it.<s%> This also is vanity and a <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H7451>evil.<s%>

For what <S%H1933>has<s%> a <S%H120>man<s%> of all his <S%H5999>labor,<s%> and of the <S%H7475>striving<s%> of his <S%H3820>heart,<s%> in <S%H1931>which<s%> he <S%H6001>labors<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun?<s%>

For all his <S%H3117>days<s%> are <S%H4341>sorrows,<s%> and his <S%H6045>travail<s%> is <S%H3708>grief;<s%> <S%H3915>yes,<s%> even in the night his <S%H3820>heart<s%> takes no <S%H7901>rest.<s%> This also is <S%H1892>vanity.<s%>

There is nothing <S%H2896>better<s%> for a <S%H120>man<s%> than that he should <S%H398>eat<s%> and <S%H8354>drink,<s%> and make his <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H7200>enjoy<s%> <S%H2896>good<s%> in his <S%H5999>labor.<s%> <S%H2090>This<s%> also I <S%H7200>saw,<s%> that it is from the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H430>God.<s%>
For who can <S%H398>eat,<s%> or who can have <S%H2363>enjoyment,<s%> more than <S%H2351>I?<s%>

For to the <S%H120>man<s%> who <S%H2896>pleases<s%> <S%H6440>him,<s%> God <S%H5414>gives<s%> <S%H2451>wisdom,<s%> <S%H1847>knowledge,<s%> and <S%H8057>joy;<s%> but to the <S%H2398>sinner<s%> he <S%H5414>gives<s%> <S%H6045>travail,<s%> to <S%H622>gather<s%> and to heap <S%H3664>up,<s%> that he may <S%H5414>give<s%> to him <S%H6440>who<s%> <S%H2896>pleases<s%> <S%H430>God.<s%> This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and a <S%H7469>chasing<s%> after <S%H7307>wind.<s%>
